stories.text:
HN is not exactly a board frequented by your avg. Joe and also lots of measures are taken in order to keep a very high signal/noise ratio in discussions.

Does HN (and other small niche online communitiies which don't actively engage in outreach to have lots of people from the general population join) engage in some sort of stealthy form of speech censorship?

With all the recent debate on free speach after Elon's purchase of Twitter I thought about this when reflecting upon all the characteristics of HN and all the rules which are necessary to keep it a community with a high signl/noise ratio in disussion.

What would Elon Musk change about HN?

Are there any chances he can get involved now that he's in the social media space?

Elon Musk is truly a God and I don't think we are worthy to live on the same planet as him.

Elon Musk is the man who sees infinty.
stories.title: Ask HN: Does HN limit free speach by not advertising itself to general public?
